meanings.definition: To combine or treat with sulfur or a sulfur compound.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will sulfurate the metal to make it more resistant to corrosion.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to sulfurate the dish with a hint of garlic for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sulfurated my socks by washing them with a sulfur-based detergent!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to sulfurate the room, filling it with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to sulfurate the painting, giving it a unique texture.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal will sulfurate and develop a greenish patina.
meanings.sent2: The fruit started to sulfurate, emitting a distinct sulfur smell.
meanings.sent3: The old book seemed to sulfurate with age, its pages turning yellow and brittle.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the air seemed to sulfurate with electricity.
meanings.sent5: The potion began to sulfurate, bubbling and releasing a pungent odor.
